description: Ground floor change of use from Library (Use Class D1) to Cinema (Use Class D2) and associated internal alterations
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titled:

AHC.D.01 - Demolition Ground Floor Plan; AHC.P.01/ Rev D - Proposed Ground Floor Plan; AHC.P.02/ Rev D - Proposed Sections A & B; AHC.P.03 - Winchester St. Windows Access Detail; AHC.P.04 - Ground Floor Wall Finishes Plan; AHC.P.05 - Ground Floor Reflected Celling Plan; ARC1118-SK61 - HVAC Layout, Roof Plan; ARC1118-SK62 - HVAC Layout, Foyer & Toilet Areas; ARC1118-SK63 - HVAC Layout, Cinema 1 & 2; ARC1118-SK64 - Cinemas 1 & 2, HVAC Sections C-C & D-D; ARC1118-080 - Cinema, Acoustic Ceiling Detail 1; ARC1118-091(1) - Cinema Sound Wall Details Wall Type W.01 (head detail); ARC1118-091(2) - Cinema Sound Wall Details Wall Type W.01 (base detail); ARC1118-092(1) - Cinema Sound Wall Details Wall Type W.02 (head detail); ARC1118-092(2) - Cinema Sound Wall Details Wall Type W.02 (base detail); ARC1118-93(1) - Cinema Sound Wall Details Wall Type W.03 (head detail); ARC1118-093(2) - Cinema Sound Wall Details Wall Type W-03 (base detail)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.

| All materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with the submitted Design and Access Statement prepared by Matthews & Son LLP dated May 2020 and the hereby approved plans listed in Condition 2 above.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7.8 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (h)(j), 1.2 (f), 2.1 and 2.10, and policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016). | All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) to be used in the development site shall meet as a minimum the Stage IIIB emission criteria of Directive 97/68/EC and its subsequent amendments, unless it can be demonstrated that Stage IIIB equipment is not available. An inventory of all NRMM shall be registered on the NRMM register at https://nrmm.london/user-nrmm/register. All NRMM shall be regularly serviced and service logs kept on site for inspection. Records shall be kept on site detailing proof of emissions standards for all equipment.

Reason: Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of type and level of noise from the cinema affecting residents/noise sensitive occupiers and the sound insulation value of the floor/ceiling/walls separating the cinema premises from dwellings/noise sensitive premises.  Details of mitigation measures shall demonstrate an acoustic standard of sound insulation between noise sensitive premises and the development of NR25 Leq 5mins (octaves) or NR20 Leq 5mins (1/3 octaves) inside a bedroom and NR30 Leq 5mins (octaves) or NR25 Leq 5mins (1/3 octaves) inside a living room when noise is generated at maximum capacity by the cinema use.  The assessment and mitigation shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the occupier of the above residential premises, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the external rating noise level emitted from plant/machinery/equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/mechanical installations, together with mitigation measures as appropriate.  The measures shall ensure that the external rating noise level LAeq emitted will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and in surrounding premises. A post installation sound assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' | The sound insulation of the building envelope and of any mitigation measures shall ensure that noise from internal uses is contained within the building, as assessed according to standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014, at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises incl. offices and external amenity spaces. Measures shall be implemented prior to use of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'

| Prior to first use of the hereby approved development, refuse and recycling storage shall be provided, as indicated on the hereby approved drawing reference AHC.P.01/ Rev D (Proposed Ground Floor Plan), in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and shall be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 5.17 and 7.4 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to first use of the hereby approved development, cycle storage for a minimum of seven (7) cycles shall be provided on site as indicated on the hereby approved plan number AHC.P.01/ Rev D, in accordance with all adopted standards and shall be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
REASON: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG, policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016) and policy T5 of the Draft New London Plan (2019).
